5!----------------------------------------------------------------------
6! This module provides support for computing forward operators for
7! radiance observations by calling the rttov radiative transfer model.
8!
9! the additional metadata in each observation includes:
10!
11! OBS X
12! rttov
13! sat az/el
14! sun az/el
15! platform
16! sat_id
17! instrument
18! channel
19! <anything else useful>
20!
21! The following is a list of all the radiances types DART can assimilate
22! using RTTOV with the following convention:
23!
24! (PLATFORM)_(SATELLITE)_(SENSOR)_RADIANCE, QTY_RADIANCE
25!
26! where PLATFORM is the satellite series (e.g. NOAA or DMSP),
27! SATELLITE is the satellite number (e.g. 18 for NOAA 18),
28! SENSOR is the satellite sensor name (e.g. AIRS for Aqua/EOS 2)
29!
30! This list is sorted in numerical order of RTTOV platform, satellite,
31! sensor ID. The list is sorted first on platform id, then in case of
32! duplicates on satellite id, then in case of duplicates on sensor ID.
33! Adding a new sensor should follow this convention.
34!
35! Below the list, the first and last radiance will be used in the select
36! case statements as follows:
37!
38! case(NOAA_1_VTPR1_RADIANCE:CLOUDSAT_1_CPR_TB)
39!
40! This ensures that all radiance types between these two numbers will be
41! handled the same way. This is a Fortran construct for a case statement
42! between two numbers, which both must be parameters. Preprocess ensures
43! that all types listed in descending order in observation def files are
44! given consecutive, ascending parameter values.
45!
46! N.B. that if another observation type is added before or after the start/end
47! (currently NOAA_1_VTPR1_RADIANCE and CLOUDSAT_1_CPR_TB, respectively),
48! all case statements in this obs def file must be modified appropriately to
49! ensure correct processing.
50!
51! The units for the microwave brightness temperatures (any observations
52! that have a quantity of QTY_BRIGHTNESS_TEMPERATURE) is degrees kelvin.
53!
54! The units for all observations with a quantity of QTY_RADANCE are as
55! described in the RTTOV v12 user guide V1.3 (p54): "mW/cm-1/sr/sq.m"
56! Doc ID: NWPSAF-MO-UD-037, Date: 05/03/2019
57!
58! The observation converters are responsible for providing these
59! observations with the correct units.
60!----------------------------------------------------------------------
61

279! interactive_rttov_metadata, &
280! get_expected_radiance

284! BEGIN DART PREPROCESS GET_EXPECTED_OBS_FROM_DEF
285! case(NOAA_1_VTPR1_RADIANCE:CLOUDSAT_1_CPR_TB)
286! call get_expected_radiance(obs_kind_ind, state_handle, ens_size, location, obs_def%key, get_obs_def_type_of_obs(obs_def), expected_obs, istatus)
287! END DART PREPROCESS GET_EXPECTED_OBS_FROM_DEF
288
289
290! BEGIN DART PREPROCESS READ_OBS_DEF
291! case(NOAA_1_VTPR1_RADIANCE:CLOUDSAT_1_CPR_TB)
292! call read_rttov_metadata(obs_def%key, key, ifile, fform)
293! END DART PREPROCESS READ_OBS_DEF
294
295
296! BEGIN DART PREPROCESS WRITE_OBS_DEF
297! case(NOAA_1_VTPR1_RADIANCE:CLOUDSAT_1_CPR_TB)
298! call write_rttov_metadata(obs_def%key, ifile, fform)
299! END DART PREPROCESS WRITE_OBS_DEF
300
301
302! BEGIN DART PREPROCESS INTERACTIVE_OBS_DEF
303! case(NOAA_1_VTPR1_RADIANCE:CLOUDSAT_1_CPR_TB)
304! call interactive_rttov_metadata(obs_def%key)
305! END DART PREPROCESS INTERACTIVE_OBS_DEF

328! This code contains the DART to RTTOV interface. It uses a data structure of
329! platforms/satellites/sensors to store runtime information for each sensor.
330! This runtime information is initialized on the fly as needed to compute the
331! RTTOV forward operator.
332!
333! Copyright:
334! RTTOV was developed within the context of
335! the EUMETSAT Satellite Application Facility on
336! Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP SAF), under the
337! Cooperation Agreement dated 25 November 1998, between
338! EUMETSAT and the Met Office, UK, by one or more partners
339! within the NWP SAF. The partners in the NWP SAF are
340! the Met Office, ECMWF, KNMI and MeteoFrance.
341!
342! RTTOV is copyright 2017, EUMETSAT, All Rights Reserved.
343

429! Metadata for rttov observations.
430type visir_metadata_type
431 real(jprb) :: sat_az ! azimuth of satellite position (degrees)
432 real(jprb) :: sat_ze ! zenith of satellite position (degrees)
433 real(jprb) :: sun_az ! azimuth of solar position (degrees, only used with add_solar)
434 real(jprb) :: sun_ze ! zenith of solar position (degrees, only used with add_solar)
435 integer(jpim) :: platform_id ! see rttov user guide, table 2
436 integer(jpim) :: sat_id ! see rttov user guide, table 2
437 integer(jpim) :: sensor_id ! see rttov user guide, table 3
438 integer(jpim) :: channel ! each channel is a different obs
439 real(jprb) :: specularity ! specularity (0-1, only used with do_lambertian)
440end type visir_metadata_type
441
442type mw_metadata_type
443 real(jprb) :: sat_az ! azimuth of satellite position (degrees)
444 real(jprb) :: sat_ze ! zenith of satellite position (degrees)
445 integer(jpim) :: platform_id ! see rttov user guide, table 2
446 integer(jpim) :: sat_id ! see rttov user guide, table 2
447 integer(jpim) :: sensor_id ! see rttov user guide, table 3
448 integer(jpim) :: channel ! each channel is a different obs
449 real(jprb) :: mag_field ! strength of mag_field (Gauss, )
450 real(jprb) :: cosbk ! cosine of angle between mag field and viewing angle
451 real(jprb) :: fastem_p1 ! FASTEM land/sea ice parameter 1
452 real(jprb) :: fastem_p2 ! FASTEM land/sea ice parameter 2
453 real(jprb) :: fastem_p3 ! FASTEM land/sea ice parameter 3
454 real(jprb) :: fastem_p4 ! FASTEM land/sea ice parameter 4
455 real(jprb) :: fastem_p5 ! FASTEM land/sea ice parameter 5
456end type mw_metadata_type
457
458! DART container type to hold the essential atmosphere and surface fields.
459! For 2D fields, the order is (ens_size, numlevels), while 1D fields are
460! (ens_size).
461type atmos_profile_type
462 real(r8), allocatable :: temperature(:,:) ! mandatory, level temperature (K)
463 real(r8), allocatable :: pressure(:,:) ! mandatory, level pressure (Pa)
464 real(r8), allocatable :: moisture(:,:) ! mandatory, level water vapor (kg/kg)
465 real(r8), allocatable :: sfc_p(:) ! mandatory, surface pressure (Pa)
466 real(r8), allocatable :: s2m_t(:) ! mandatory, 2 meter temp (K)
467 real(r8), allocatable :: skin_temp(:) ! mandatory, surface skin temp (K)
468 real(r8), allocatable :: sfc_elev(:) ! mandatory, surface elevation (m)
469 real(r8), allocatable :: surftype(:) ! mandatory, surface type (land=0, water=1, seaice = 2)
470 real(r8), allocatable :: s2m_q(:) ! optional, 2 meter wator vapor (kg/kg) (used if add_q2m)
471 real(r8), allocatable :: s10m_u(:) ! optional, 10 meter u wind (m/s) (used if add_uv10m)
472 real(r8), allocatable :: s10m_v(:) ! optional, 10 meter v wind (m/s) (used if add_uv10m)
473 real(r8), allocatable :: wfetch(:) ! optional, wind fetch (m) (used if use_wfetch)
474 real(r8), allocatable :: water_type(:) ! optional, water type (fresh=0, ocean=1) (used if use_water_type)
475 real(r8), allocatable :: sfc_salinity(:) ! optional, ocean salinity (practial salinity unit) (used if use_salinity)
476 real(r8), allocatable :: sfc_foam_frac(:) ! optional, foam fraction (0-1) (used if supply_foam_fraction)
477 real(r8), allocatable :: sfc_snow_frac(:) ! optional, snow cover (0-1) (used if use_sfc_snow_frac)
478end type atmos_profile_type
479
480! container type for trace gasses. Note these values are on levels, so the
481! size of the arrays are (ens_size, numlevels)
482type trace_gas_profile_type
483 real(r8), allocatable :: ozone(:,:) ! ozone concentration (kg/kg) (used if add_ozone)
484 real(r8), allocatable :: co2(:,:) ! CO2 concentration (kg/kg) (used if add_co2)
485 real(r8), allocatable :: n2o(:,:) ! N2O concentration (kg/kg) (used if add_n2o)
486 real(r8), allocatable :: ch4(:,:) ! CH4 concentration (kg/kg) (used if add_ch4)
487 real(r8), allocatable :: co(:,:) ! CO concentration (kg/kg) (used if add_co)
488 real(r8), allocatable :: so2(:,:) ! SO2 concentration (kg/kg) (used if add_so2)
489end type trace_gas_profile_type
490
491! Container type for aerosols. Note these values are on layers, so the
492! size of the arrays are (ens_size, numlevels-1)
493type aerosol_profile_type
494 real(r8), allocatable :: insoluble(:,:) ! INSO (kg/kg), OPAC only
495 real(r8), allocatable :: water_soluble(:,:) ! WASO, OPAC
496 real(r8), allocatable :: soot(:,:) ! SOOT, OPAC
497 real(r8), allocatable :: sea_salt_accum(:,:) ! SSAM, OPAC
498 real(r8), allocatable :: sea_salt_coarse(:,:) ! SSCM, OPAC
499 real(r8), allocatable :: mineral_nucleus(:,:) ! MINM, OPAC
500 real(r8), allocatable :: mineral_accum(:,:) ! MIAM, OPAC
501 real(r8), allocatable :: mineral_coarse(:,:) ! MICM, OPAC
502 real(r8), allocatable :: mineral_transport(:,:) ! MITR, OPAC
503 real(r8), allocatable :: sulphated_droplets(:,:) ! SUSO, OPAC
504 real(r8), allocatable :: volcanic_ash(:,:) ! VOLA, OPAC
505 real(r8), allocatable :: new_volcanic_ash(:,:) ! VAPO, OPAC
506 real(r8), allocatable :: asian_dust(:,:) ! ASDU, OPAC
507 real(r8), allocatable :: black_carbon(:,:) ! BCAR, CAMS
508 real(r8), allocatable :: dust_bin1(:,:) ! DUS1, CAMS
509 real(r8), allocatable :: dust_bin2(:,:) ! DUS2, CAMS
510 real(r8), allocatable :: dust_bin3(:,:) ! DUS3, CAMS
511 real(r8), allocatable :: ammonium_sulphate(:,:) ! SULP, CAMS
512 real(r8), allocatable :: sea_salt_bin1(:,:) ! SSA1, CAMS
513 real(r8), allocatable :: sea_salt_bin2(:,:) ! SSA2, CAMS
514 real(r8), allocatable :: sea_salt_bin3(:,:) ! SSA3, CAMS
515 real(r8), allocatable :: hydrophilic_organic_matter(:,:) ! OMAT, CAMS
516end type aerosol_profile_type
517
518! container type for clouds - note RTTOV uses different cloud fields depending on scheme, frequency, type, etc. Note these values are on layers, not levels, so the
519! size of the arrays are (ens_size, numlevels-1)
520type cloud_profile_type
521 real(r8), allocatable :: cfrac(:,:) ! (VIS/IR/MW) cloud fractional cover (0-1)
522 real(r8), allocatable :: simple_cfrac(:) ! (VIS/IR) cloud fraction for simple cloud (0-1)
523 real(r8), allocatable :: ctp(:) ! (VIS/IR) cloud top pressure for simple cloud (hPa)
524 real(r8), allocatable :: w(:,:) ! (VIS/IR) vertical velocity (used for classification of cumulus vs. stratus)
525 real(r8), allocatable :: clw(:,:) ! (VIS/IR/MW) cloud non-precipitating water
526 real(r8), allocatable :: rain(:,:) ! (VIS/IR/MW) cloud precipitating water
527 real(r8), allocatable :: ciw(:,:) ! (VIS/IR/MW) cloud non-precipitating ice concentration
528 real(r8), allocatable :: snow(:,:) ! (VIS/IR/MW) cloud precipitating ice (fluffy)
529 real(r8), allocatable :: graupel(:,:) ! (VIS/IR/MW) cloud precipitating ice (soft hail / snow pellets)
530 real(r8), allocatable :: hail(:,:) ! (VIS/IR/MW) cloud precipitating ice (hard hail)
531 real(r8), allocatable :: clwde(:,:) ! (VIS/IR) cloud liquid effective diameter if clw_scheme = 2
532 real(r8), allocatable :: icede(:,:) ! (VIS/IR) cloud liquid effective diameter if ice_scheme = 1
533end type cloud_profile_type
534
535! Container for the DART/rttov run-time structures to be used (per sensor)
536! This is setup per sensor in accordance with Figure 1 of the RTTOV user guide,
537! which indicates the allocation is per coefficient file, which is
538! per sensor. RTTOV_alloc_direct also takes in the coefficient file. It's
539! not clear if some of these structures could be reused across different
540! sensors - to be safe, they are gathered together here. There will be
541! one runtime per sensor, but the runtime will only be allocated when the
542! sensor is used by a forward operator.
543type rttov_sensor_runtime_type
544 type(rttov_options), pointer :: opts => null() ! Options for RTTOV-DIRECT
545 type(rttov_options_scatt), pointer :: opts_scatt => null() ! Options for RTTOV-SCATT
546 type(rttov_coefs) :: coefs ! Sensor coefficients structure
547 type(rttov_scatt_coef), pointer :: coefs_scatt => null() ! Sensor coefficients structure
548 type(rttov_chanprof), pointer :: chanprof(:) => null() ! Input channel/profile list
549 integer(kind=jpim), pointer :: frequencies(:) => null() ! Indexes into Mietable lookup
550 integer(kind=jpim), pointer :: frequencies_all(:) => null() ! Indexes into Mietable lookup
551 logical(kind=jplm), pointer :: calcemis(:) => null() ! Flag to indicate calculation of emissivity within RTTOV
552 type(rttov_emissivity), pointer :: emissivity(:) => null() ! Input/output surface emissivity
553 logical(kind=jplm), pointer :: calcrefl(:) => null() ! Flag to indicate calculation of BRDF within RTTOV
554 type(rttov_reflectance), pointer :: reflectance(:) => null() ! Input/output surface BRDF
555 type(rttov_profile), pointer :: profiles(:) => null() ! Input profiles
556 type(rttov_profile_cloud), pointer :: cld_profiles(:) => null() ! Input profiles
557 type(rttov_transmission) :: transmission ! Output transmittances
558 type(rttov_radiance) :: radiance ! Output radiances
559end type rttov_sensor_runtime_type
560
561! a simple fortran type containing the generic sensor information
562type rttov_sensor_type
563 integer :: platform_id
564 integer :: satellite_id
565 integer :: sensor_id
566 character(len=512) :: base_obs_type
567 character(len=3) :: sensor_type_name ! mw, ir, or vis
568 integer :: sensor_type_num ! vis = 1, ir = 2, mw = 3
569 character(len=512) :: coefficient_file
570 integer, allocatable :: channels(:) ! list of channels to use
571
572 ! Runtime per-sensor RTTOV structures used to execute the forward operator
573 type(rttov_sensor_runtime_type), pointer :: runtime => null()
574
575 ! Linked-list of rttov_sensor_types, sorted (asc) by sensor_id
576 type(rttov_sensor_type), pointer :: next_sensor => null()
577end type rttov_sensor_type
578
579type rttov_satellite_type
580 ! this is a singly-linked sorted (asc by sensor_id) list of sensors on the satellite
581 type(rttov_sensor_type), pointer :: head
582end type rttov_satellite_type
583
584type rttov_platform_type
585 ! this is a trie - each array index corresponds to the satellite number
586 type(rttov_satellite_type), pointer :: sats(:)
587end type rttov_platform_type
588
589! this is a trie - each array index corresponds to the platform number
590type(rttov_platform_type), pointer :: platforms(:)

627! -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
628! DART/RTTOV options in the input.nml namelist.
629!
630! DART exposes all of the RTTOV 12.3 options available and passes them to
631! RTTOV with little to no additional checking for consistency. The default in
632! most cases can be used and need not be specified in the namelist.
633!
634! See the RTTOV user guide Annex O for more information on these options.
635!
636! Note a new option must be also be transfered in
637! initialize_rttov_sensor_runtime
638! -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
639logical :: first_lvl_is_sfc = .true. ! is level 1 the surface (true) or top of atmosphere (false)?
640logical :: mw_clear_sky_only = .false. ! only use clear-sky for MW (plus clw emission if clw_data is true) or full RTTOV-SCATT (false)?
641integer :: interp_mode = 1 ! Interpolation mode: Rochon on OD (1), Log-linear (2), Rochon on log-linear OD (3), Rochon on WF (4), Rochon on log-linear WF (5)
642logical :: do_checkinput = .true. ! check if profiles are within absolute and regression limits
643logical :: apply_reg_limits = .false. ! clamp to min/max values
644logical :: verbose = .true. ! if false, only fatal errors output
645logical :: fix_hgpl = .false. ! surface elevation assigned to 2m pressure (true) or surface pressure (false)
646logical :: do_lambertian = .false. ! treat surface as Lambertian instead of specular? (all)
647logical :: lambertian_fixed_angle = .true. ! use fixed angle for Lambertian calculations? (all, do_lambertian only)
648logical :: rad_down_lin_tau = .true. ! use linear-in-tau approximation? (all)
649real(r8) :: max_zenith_angle = 75. ! maximum zenith angle to accept (in degrees) (all)
650logical :: use_q2m = .false. ! use surface humidity? (all)
651logical :: use_uv10m = .false. ! use u and v 10 meters? (all, used in sea surface emissivity and BRDF models)
652logical :: use_wfetch = .false. ! use wind fetch (length of water wind has blown over in m) (all, used in sea surface BRDF models)
653logical :: use_water_type = .false. ! use water type (0 = fresh, ocean = 1) (all, used in surface BRDF atlas and models)
654logical :: addrefrac = .false. ! enable atmospheric refraction (all)
655logical :: plane_parallel = .false. ! treat atmosphere as strictly plane-parallel? (all)
656logical :: use_salinity = .false. ! use ocean salinity (in practical salinity units) (MW, FASTEM 4-6 and TESSEM2)
657logical :: apply_band_correction= .true. ! apply band correction from coef file? (MW)
658logical :: cfrac_data = .false. ! specify cloud fraction? (VIS/IR/MW)
659logical :: clw_data = .false. ! specify non-precip cloud liquid water? (VIS/IR/MW)
660logical :: rain_data = .false. ! specify precip cloud liquid water? (VIS/IR/MW)
661logical :: ciw_data = .false. ! specify non-precip cloud ice? (VIS/IR/MW)
662logical :: snow_data = .false. ! specify precip cloud fluffy ice? (VIS/IR/MW)
663logical :: graupel_data = .false. ! specify precip cloud soft-hail? (VIS/IR/MW)
664logical :: hail_data = .false. ! specify precip cloud hard-hail? (VIS/IR/MW)
665logical :: w_data = .false. ! specify vertical velocity (used for classifying clouds as cumulus versus stratus)? (VIS/IR)
666integer :: clw_scheme = 2 ! Liebe (1) or Rosenkranz (2) or TKC (3) (MW, clear-sky only)
667real(r8) :: clw_cloud_top = 322.0_r8 ! lower hPa limit for clw calculations; clw at lower pressures is ignored (MW, clear-sky only)
668integer :: fastem_version = 6 ! MW sea-surface emissivity model to use (0-6). 1-6: FASTEM version 1-6, 0: TESSEM2 (MW)
669logical :: supply_foam_fraction = .false. ! include foam fraction in skin%foam_fraction? FASTEM only. (MW)
670logical :: use_totalice = .false. ! Specify totalice instead of precip/non-precip ice (MW, RTTOV-SCATT only)
671logical :: use_zeeman = .false. ! Simulate Zeeman effect (MW)
672real(r8) :: cc_threshold = 0.050_r8 ! if effective cloud fraction below this value, treat simulation as clear-sky (MW, 0-1, RTTOV-SCATT only)
673logical :: ozone_data = .false. ! specify ozone profiles? (VIS/IR)
674logical :: co2_data = .false. ! specify CO2 profiles? (VIS/IR)
675logical :: n2o_data = .false. ! specify N2O profiles? (VIS/IR)
676logical :: co_data = .false. ! specify CO profiles? (VIS/IR)
677logical :: ch4_data = .false. ! specify CH4 profiles? (VIS/IR)
678logical :: so2_data = .false. ! specify SO2 profiles? (VIS/IR)
679logical :: addsolar = .false. ! include solar calculations (VIS/IR)
680logical :: rayleigh_single_scatt = .true. ! if false, disable Rayleigh (VIS, addsolar only)
681logical :: do_nlte_correction = .false. ! if true include non-LTE bias correction for hires sounders (VIS/IR)
682integer :: solar_sea_brdf_model = 2 ! JONSWAP (1) or Elfouhaily (2) (VIS)
683integer :: ir_sea_emis_model = 2 ! ISEM (1) or IREMIS (2) (IR)
684logical :: use_sfc_snow_frac = .false. ! use sfc snow cover (0-1) (IR, used in emis atlas)
685logical :: add_aerosl = .false. ! enable aerosol scattering (VIS/IR)
686integer :: aerosl_type = 1 ! OPAC (1) or CAMS (2) (VIS/IR, add_aerosl only)
687logical :: add_clouds = .true. ! enable cloud scattering (VIS/IR)
688integer :: ice_scheme = 1 ! SSEC (1) or Baran 2014 (2) or Baran 2018 (3) (VIS/IR, add_clouds only)
689logical :: use_icede = .false. ! use ice effective diameter (IR, add_clouds, ice_scheme = 1)
690integer :: idg_scheme = 2 ! Ou and Liou (1), Wyser (2), Boudala (3), McFarquar (2003) (VIS/IR, add_clouds only, ice_scheme = 1)
691logical :: user_aer_opt_param = .false. ! specify aerosol scattering properties (VIS/IR, add_clouds only)
692logical :: user_cld_opt_param = .false. ! specify cloud scattering properties (VIS/IR, add_clouds only)
693logical :: grid_box_avg_cloud = .true. ! cloud concentrations are grid box averages. False = concentrations for cloudy layer only. (VIS/IR, add_clouds and not user_cld_opt_param only)
694real(r8) :: cldstr_threshold = -1.0_r8 ! threshold for cloud stream weights for scattering (VIS/IR, add_clouds only)
695logical :: cldstr_simple = .false. ! If true, one clear column, one cloudy column (VIS/IR, add_clouds only)
696real(r8) :: cldstr_low_cloud_top = 750.0_r8 ! cloud fraction maximum in layers from ToA down to specified hPa (VIS/IR, cldstr_simple only)
697integer :: ir_scatt_model = 2 ! DOM (1) or Chou-scaling (2) (IR, add_clouds or add_aerosl only)
698integer :: vis_scatt_model = 1 ! DOM (1), single scat (2), or MFASIS (3) (VIS, addsolar and add_clouds or add_aerosl only)
699integer :: dom_nstreams = 8 ! number of streams to use with DOM (VIS/IR, add_clouds or add_aerosl and DOM model only, must be >= 2 and even)
700real(r8) :: dom_accuracy = 0.0_r8 ! convergence criteria for DOM (VIS/IR, add_clouds or addaerosol and DOM model only)
701real(r8) :: dom_opdep_threshold = 0.0_r8 ! DOM ignores layers below this optical depth (VIS/IR, add_clouds or addaerosol and DOM model only)
702logical :: addpc = .false. ! do principal component calculations? (VIS/IR)
703integer :: npcscores = -1 ! number of PC scores to use (VIS/IR, addpc only)
704logical :: addradrec = .false. ! reconstruct the radiances (VIS/IR, addpc only)
705integer :: ipcreg = 1 ! number of predictors, see Table 29 of user guide (VIS/IR, addpc only)
706logical :: use_htfrtc = .false. ! use HTFRTC of Havemann 2018
707integer :: htfrtc_n_pc = -1 ! number of PCs to use (HTFRTC only, max 300)
708logical :: htfrtc_simple_cloud = .false. ! use simple-cloud scattering (HTFRTC only)
709logical :: htfrtc_overcast = .false. ! calculate overcast radiances (HTFRTC only)

822!----------------------------------------------------------------------
823! Add a sensor to the platform/sat/sensor data structures with the
824! given information. Note that this will create the platform, satellite,
825! and/or sensors as necessary.
826!
827subroutine add_sensor(platform_id, satellite_id, sensor_id, sensor_type_name, &
828 base_obs_type, coef_file, channels)
829
830 integer, intent(in) :: platform_id ! the RTTOV platform id
831 integer, intent(in) :: satellite_id ! the RTTOV satellite id
832 integer, intent(in) :: sensor_id ! the RTTOV sensor id
833 character(len=*), intent(in) :: sensor_type_name ! the type of sensor (vis, ir, mw)
834 character(len=*), intent(in) :: base_obs_type ! the DART observation type without _RADIANCE, _TB, or _BDRF
835 character(len=*), intent(in) :: coef_file ! the RTTOV coefficient file
836 integer, intent(in) :: channels(:) ! the channels to simulate (or 0-length for all)
837
838 integer :: i, new_size
839
840 type(rttov_platform_type), pointer :: tmp_platforms(:) ! temporary platform array, for dynamic growing
841 type(rttov_satellite_type), pointer :: tmp_satellites(:) ! temporary satellite array, for dynamic growing
842
843 type(rttov_platform_type), pointer :: platform
844 type(rttov_satellite_type), pointer :: satellite
845 type(rttov_sensor_type), pointer :: sensor
846 type(rttov_sensor_type), pointer :: new_sensor
847 type(rttov_sensor_type), pointer :: last_sensor
848
849 character(len=*), parameter :: routine = 'add_sensor'
850
851 character(len=512) :: string1
852 character(len=512) :: string2
853
854 string2 = 'name: ' // trim(base_obs_type)
855
856 ! check
857 if (platform_id <= 0 .or. satellite_id < 0 .or. sensor_id < 0) then
858 write(string1,*)'Invalid platform/satellite/sensor id:',&
859 platform_id, ',',satellite_id,',',sensor_id
860 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
861 end if
862
863 ! allocate the platforms trie if necessary
864 if (.not. associated(platforms)) then
865 allocate(platforms(num_platforms_initial))
866
867 do i=1,size(platforms)
868 ! by default, leave the contained sats trie null
869 platforms(i) % sats => null()
870 end do
871
872 if (debug) then
873 write(string1,*)'allocated platforms:',size(platforms)
874 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
875 end if
876 end if
877
878 ! check if we need to expand platforms array
879 ! can't combine this with the above as platform_id may be too large at different times
880 if (platform_id > size(platforms)) then
881
882 new_size = 2*size(platforms)
883
884 if (platform_id > new_size) then
885 write(string1,*) 'Error: platform ID is too large: ',platform_id,'vs.',new_size
886 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
887 else
888 write(string1,*)'Resizing platform size from ',size(platforms),'to',&
889 new_size
890 call error_handler(e_warn, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
891
892 ! increase the size of platforms array
893 allocate(tmp_platforms(new_size))
894
895 do i=1,size(platforms)
896 ! copy the pointer to the sats array
897 tmp_platforms(i) % sats => platforms(i) % sats
898 end do
899
900 do i=size(platforms)+1,new_size
901 tmp_platforms(i) % sats => null()
902 end do
903
904 ! make the switch. deallocate the platform array
905 deallocate(platforms)
906 platforms => tmp_platforms
907 end if
908 end if
909
910 platform => platforms(platform_id)
911
912 ! allocate the sats trie if necessary
913 if (.not. associated(platform % sats)) then
914 ! there are satellites with id 0, so start from 0 index
915 allocate(platform % sats(0:num_satellites_initial-1))
916
917 ! initialize the sensor linked list to null
918 do i=0,size(platform % sats)-1
919 platform % sats(i) % head => null()
920 end do
921
922 if (debug) then
923 write(string1,*) 'allocated platform sats:',platform_id,size(platform % sats)
924 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
925 end if
926 end if
927
928 ! check if we would need to expand the sats array
929 if (satellite_id > size(platform % sats)-1) then
930
931 new_size = 2*size(platform % sats)
932
933 if (satellite_id > new_size-1) then
934 write(string1,*) 'Error: satellite ID is too large: ',satellite_id,'vs.',new_size
935 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
936 else
937 write(string1,*) 'Resizing platform % sats size from ',size(platform % sats),'to',&
938 new_size
939 call error_handler(e_warn, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
940
941 allocate(tmp_satellites(0:new_size))
942
943 ! copy the pointers for the linked list over
944 do i=0,size(platform % sats)-1
945 tmp_satellites(i) % head => platform % sats(i) % head
946 end do
947
948 do i=size(platform % sats),new_size-1
949 tmp_satellites(i) % head => null()
950 end do
951
952 ! make the switch
953 deallocate(platform % sats)
954 platform % sats => tmp_satellites
955 end if
956 end if
957
958 ! get the satellite pointer from the sats trie
959 satellite => platform % sats(satellite_id)
960
961 ! setup our new sensor structure to be added
962 allocate(new_sensor)
963 new_sensor % platform_id = platform_id
964 new_sensor % satellite_id = satellite_id
965 new_sensor % sensor_id = sensor_id
966 new_sensor % base_obs_type = base_obs_type
967 new_sensor % sensor_type_name = sensor_type_name
968
969 if (trim(sensor_type_name) == 'vis') then
970 new_sensor % sensor_type_num = 1
971 elseif (trim(sensor_type_name) == 'ir') then
972 new_sensor % sensor_type_num = 2
973 elseif (trim(sensor_type_name) == 'mw') then
974 new_sensor % sensor_type_num = 3
975 elseif (trim(sensor_type_name) == 'po') then
976 new_sensor % sensor_type_num = 4
977 elseif (trim(sensor_type_name) == 'hi') then
978 new_sensor % sensor_type_num = 5
979 else
980 write(string1,*) 'Error: unknown sensor_type_name: ', trim(sensor_type_name),':',&
981 platform_id,satellite_id,sensor_id
982 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
983 end if
984
985 new_sensor % coefficient_file = coef_file
986 allocate(new_sensor % channels(size(channels)))
987 new_sensor % channels(:) = channels(:)
988 new_sensor % next_sensor => null()
989
990 ! traverse the sensor list. Insert the node so the list is sorted.
991 last_sensor => null()
992 sensor => satellite % head
993
994 linkedlist: do
995 if (.not. associated(sensor)) then
996 ! reached the end of the list. Add new_sensor to the end
997 if (.not. associated(last_sensor)) then
998 ! update head => new_sensor
999 satellite % head => new_sensor
1000 else
1001 ! update last_sensor % next => sensor
1002 last_sensor % next_sensor => new_sensor
1003 end if
1004
1005 exit ! the linked list loop
1006 end if
1007
1008 ! check for duplicates
1009 if (sensor_id == sensor % sensor_id) then
1010 write(string1,*) 'Error: tried to add the same sensor to a satellite twice:',&
1011 platform_id,satellite_id,sensor_id
1012 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
1013 end if
1014
1015 ! if the sensor id to add is greater than the current one, we found our spot:
1016 ! we need to put the new sensor in between sensor and last_sensor
1017 if (sensor_id > sensor % sensor_id) then
1018
1019 ! update new_sensor % next => sensor
1020 new_sensor % next_sensor => sensor
1021
1022 if (associated(last_sensor)) then
1023 ! update last_sensor % next => new_sensor % next => sensor
1024 last_sensor % next_sensor => new_sensor
1025 else
1026 ! update head => new_sensor % next => sensor
1027 satellite % head => new_sensor
1028 end if
1029
1030 exit ! the linked list loop
1031 else
1032 ! traverse forward in the list and keep looking
1033 last_sensor => sensor
1034 sensor => sensor % next_sensor
1035 end if
1036 end do linkedlist
1037end subroutine add_sensor
1038
1039!----------------------------------------------------------------------
1040! Read the sensor DB file and setup the relevant data structures.
1041! This function will read through the DB file twice: once to
1042! discover how many lines are in the file and the maximum line
1043! length, and a second time to actually parse the contents of the
1044! file. The contents of the file are assumed to be an "unformatted"
1045! (aka text) CSV file with the following contents:
1046!
1047! <base_obs_type>,<platform_id>,<satellite_id>,<sensor_id>,<sensor_type>,<coef_file>,[channel list]
1048!
1049! where:
1050! base_obs_type is the DART observation quantity minus _RADIANCE, _TB, or _BDRF
1051! platform_id is the RTTOV platform id
1052! satellite_id is the RTTOV satellite id
1053! sensor_id is the RTTOV sensor id
1054! sensor_type is vis, ir, or mw (visible, infrared, or microwave)
1055! coef_file is the RTTOV coefficient file
1056! channel_list is an optional list of channels (can be zero-length, meaning all available channels should be used)
1057!
1058subroutine read_sensor_db_file(sensor_db_file)
1059
1060character(len=*), intent(in) :: sensor_db_file
1061
1062! a buffer to use for reading the file piece by piece
1063integer, parameter :: buffer_len = 80
1064character(len=buffer_len) :: buffer
1065character(len=2048) :: next_line
1066
1067integer :: nlines, io, size_read, line_len, maxline_len
1068integer :: i
1069character(len=100) :: imsg
1070
1071character(len=256) :: base_obs_type
1072integer :: dbunit
1073integer :: platform_id
1074integer :: satellite_id
1075integer :: sensor_id
1076integer :: ntok, toknum, lastind
1077integer, allocatable :: channels(:)
1078character(len=16) :: sensor_type
1079character(len=512) :: coef_file
1080character(len=512) :: token
1081! assume the file is delimited by commas
1082character(len=*), parameter :: delimiter = ','
1083
1084character(len=*), parameter :: routine = 'read_sensor_db_file'
1085
1086character(len=512) :: string1, string2
1087
1088if ( file_exist(sensor_db_file) ) then
1089 dbunit = open_file(sensor_db_file, action='read')
1090else
1091 write(string1,*)'sensor_db_file: "'//adjustl(trim(sensor_db_file))//'"'
1092 write(string2,*)'does not exist.'
1093 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
1094end if
1095
1096! throw away the header row
1097read(dbunit,'(A)') buffer
1098
1099! Now count the number of lines in the file.
1100! While we are at it, find the size of a string large enough to hold
1101! the longest line for error checking
1102nlines = 0
1103maxline_len = -1
1104
1105testlineloop: do
1106 line_len = 0
1107 ! the next loop finds the length of each line
1108 bufferloop: do
1109 read(dbunit,'(A)',iostat=io,iomsg=imsg,advance='no',size=size_read) buffer
1110
1111 if (io == 0) then
1112 ! 0 = no error, read the full buffer, continue
1113 line_len = line_len + buffer_len
1114 elseif (io == -1) then
1115 ! -1 = end of file reached. Exit both loops.
1116 exit ! the buffer loop
1117 elseif (io <= 0) then
1118 ! Different compilers have different end of record iostat values
1119 ! All return a negative value not equal to -1, however.
1120 line_len = line_len + size_read
1121 nlines = nlines + 1
1122 maxline_len = max(maxline_len,line_len)
1123 exit ! the buffer loop
1124 else
1125 ! for any other error, quit
1126 write(string1,*)'fatal error:',io,imsg
1127 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1128 end if
1129 end do bufferloop
1130
1131 if (io == -1) then
1132 ! all compilers have -1 = end of file
1133 exit ! the line loop
1134 end if
1135end do testlineloop
1136
1137if (debug) then
1138 write(string1,*)'found nlines:',nlines,'max len:',maxline_len
1139 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1140end if
1141
1142if (maxline_len > len(next_line)) then
1143 write(string1,*)'The length of a line in the ' // trim(sensor_db_file) &
1144 //' file exceeds the maximum: ',maxline_len,'vs.',len(next_line)
1145 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1146end if
1147
1148rewind(dbunit)
1149
1150! throw away the header again
1151read(dbunit,'(A)') buffer
1152
1153lineloop: do
1154 read(dbunit,'(A)', iostat=io) next_line
1155 if (io == 0) then
1156 if (debug) then
1157 write(string1,*)'read the line:',trim(next_line)
1158 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1159 end if
1160 else
1161 exit ! the line loop
1162 end if
1163
1164 toknum = 0
1165 lastind = 1
1166
1167 ntok = 0
1168
1169 ! first pass: count the number of tokens
1170 do i=1,len(next_line)
1171 if (next_line(i:i) == delimiter .or. i==len(next_line)) then
1172 ntok = ntok + 1
1173 end if
1174 end do
1175
1176 if (debug) then
1177 write(string1,*)'found ntokens:',ntok
1178 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1179 end if
1180
1181 allocate(channels(ntok-6))
1182
1183 ! second pass: parse the tokens
1184 do i=1,len(next_line)
1185 if (next_line(i:i) == delimiter .or. i == len(next_line)) then
1186 toknum = toknum + 1
1187 token = adjustl(trim(next_line(lastind:i-1)))
1188 if (debug) then
1189 write(string1,*)'found the token :',toknum,trim(token)
1190 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1191 end if
1192 select case (toknum)
1193 case (1)
1194 base_obs_type = token
1195 case (2)
1196 platform_id = str2int(token)
1197 case (3)
1198 satellite_id = str2int(token)
1199 case (4)
1200 sensor_id = str2int(token)
1201 case (5)
1202 sensor_type = token
1203 case (6)
1204 coef_file = token
1205 case default
1206 channels(toknum-6) = str2int(token)
1207 end select
1208
1209 lastind = i + 1
1210 end if
1211 end do
1212
1213 if (debug) then
1214 write(string1,*)'values:',trim(base_obs_type),platform_id,satellite_id,sensor_id,&
1215 trim(sensor_type),trim(coef_file),channels
1216 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1217 end if
1218
1219 call add_sensor(platform_id, satellite_id, sensor_id, sensor_type, base_obs_type, &
1220 coef_file, channels)
1221
1222 deallocate(channels)
1223end do lineloop
1224
1225call close_file(dbunit)
1226
1227end subroutine read_sensor_db_file
1228
1229!----------------------------------------------------------------------
1230! Function to return the sensor associated with the given platform/sat/
1231! sensor id. If no sensor is found or if invalid id combinations are
1232! passed in, an error will be generated.
1233!
1234function get_rttov_sensor(instrument_id) result(sensor)
1235
1236integer, intent(in) :: instrument_id(3)
1237
1238integer :: platform_id
1239integer :: satellite_id
1240integer :: sensor_id
1241
1242type(rttov_platform_type), pointer :: platform
1243type(rttov_satellite_type), pointer :: satellite
1244type(rttov_sensor_type), pointer :: sensor
1245
1246character(len=*), parameter :: routine = 'get_rttov_sensor'
1247
1248character(len=512) :: string1
1249
1250platform_id = instrument_id(1)
1251satellite_id = instrument_id(2)
1252sensor_id = instrument_id(3)
1253
1254if (platform_id <= 0 .or. platform_id > size(platforms) .or. &
1255 satellite_id < 0 .or. sensor_id < 0) then
1256 write(string1,*)'Invalid platform/satellite/sensor id:', platform_id, ',',&
1257 satellite_id,',',sensor_id
1258 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1259end if
1260
1261platform => platforms(platform_id)
1262
1263if (satellite_id > size(platform % sats)-1) then
1264 write(string1,*)'Invalid satellite id:', satellite_id,size(platform % sats)-1
1265 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1266end if
1267
1268satellite => platform % sats(satellite_id)
1269
1270sensor => satellite % head
1271
1272linkedlist: do
1273 ! reached the end of the list, but didn't find what we were looking for.
1274 if (.not. associated(sensor)) then
1275 write(string1,*)'Could not find the sensor with the platform/satellite/sensor id:',&
1276 platform_id,satellite_id,sensor_id
1277 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1278 end if
1279
1280 ! check for our id
1281 if (sensor_id == sensor % sensor_id) then
1282 ! found it - return without error (function result is sensor)
1283 return
1284 end if
1285
1286 ! if the sensor id is greater than the current one, we are out of luck
1287 if (sensor_id > sensor % sensor_id) then
1288 write(string1,*)'Could not find the sensor with the platform/satellite/sensor id:',&
1289 platform_id,satellite_id,sensor_id
1290 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1291 else
1292 ! moving on to the next sensor in the list
1293 sensor => sensor % next_sensor
1294 end if
1295end do linkedlist
1296
1297end function get_rttov_sensor
1298
1299!----------------------------------------------------------------------
1300! Clean up (deallocate and nullify) the platforms/satellite/sensors data
1301! structures.
1302!
1303subroutine clean_up_sensors()
1304
1305type(rttov_platform_type), pointer :: platform
1306type(rttov_satellite_type), pointer :: satellite
1307type(rttov_sensor_type), pointer :: sensor
1308type(rttov_sensor_type), pointer :: next_sensor
1309
1310integer :: i, j, error_status
1311
1312do i=1,size(platforms)
1313 platform => platforms(i)
1314
1315 do j=1,size(platform % sats)
1316 satellite => platform % sats(j)
1317
1318 sensor => satellite % head
1319
1320 do while (associated(sensor))
1321 next_sensor => sensor % next_sensor
1322
1323 if (allocated(sensor % channels)) then
1324 deallocate(sensor % channels)
1325 end if
1326
1327 if (associated(sensor % runtime)) then
1328 call sensor_runtime_takedown(sensor % runtime, error_status)
1329 deallocate(sensor % runtime)
1330 end if
1331
1332 deallocate(sensor)
1333
1334 sensor => next_sensor
1335 end do
1336
1337 nullify(satellite % head)
1338 end do
1339
1340 deallocate(platform % sats)
1341 nullify(platform % sats)
1342end do
1343
1344deallocate(platforms)
1345nullify(platforms)
1346end subroutine clean_up_sensors
1347
1348!----------------------------------------------------------------------
1349! A helper function to convert a character(len=*) into an integer
1350!
1351function str2int(str) result(intv)
1352
1353character(len=*), intent(in) :: str
1354
1355integer :: strlength
1356integer :: intv
1357
1358strlength = len_trim(adjustl(str))
1359if (strlength > 9) then
1360 print *,'Error: integer string length is greater than 9 digits long.'
1361 stop
1362end if
1363
1364read(str,*) intv
1365
1366end function str2int
1367
1368!----------------------------------------------------------------------
1369! Setup the sensor runtime structures for use with RTTOV in DART. Note
1370! that this loads the RTTOV coefficient file, allocates memory, sets the
1371! RTTOV options, and provides some basic-level of error checking.
1372!
1373subroutine sensor_runtime_setup(sensor, ens_size, nlevs, opts, opts_scatt, &
1374 use_totalice)
1375
1376type(rttov_sensor_type), intent(inout) :: sensor
1377integer, intent(in) :: ens_size
1378integer, intent(in) :: nlevs
1379type(rttov_options), pointer :: opts
1380type(rttov_options_scatt), optional, pointer :: opts_scatt
1381logical, optional, intent(in) :: use_totalice ! only relevant if opts_scatt is present
1382
1383character(len=*), parameter :: routine = 'sensor_runtime_setup'
1384
1385character(len=512) :: string1
1386character(len=512) :: string2 ! used to hold the sensor % base_obs_type, don't overwrite
1387
1388type(rttov_sensor_runtime_type), pointer :: runtime
1389
1390integer :: nchannels
1391
1392! Return error status of RTTOV subroutine calls
1393integer(kind=jpim) :: errorstatus
1394
1395logical :: do_totalice
1396
1397integer :: instrument(3) ! platform_id, satellite_id, sensor_id
1398integer :: alloc_status
1399integer :: i, ich, nch
1400
1401logical(kind=jplm), pointer :: use_chan(:,:) => null() ! flags to specify channels to simulate
1402
1403! used below, don't overwrite
1404string2 = 'name: ' // trim(sensor % base_obs_type)
1405
1406instrument(1) = sensor % platform_id
1407instrument(2) = sensor % satellite_id
1408instrument(3) = sensor % sensor_id
1409
1410if (associated(sensor % runtime)) then
1411 write(string1,*)'Runtime information already initialized for platform/sat/sensor id combination:',&
1412 instrument
1413 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
1414end if
1415
1416if (debug) then
1417 write(string1,*) 'Now initializing the platform/sat/sensor id combination:',&
1418 instrument
1419 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
1420end if
1421
1422allocate(runtime)
1423sensor % runtime => runtime
1424
1425! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1426! 1. Set options
1427! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1428
1429runtime % opts => opts
1430
1431if (present(opts_scatt)) then
1432 runtime % opts_scatt => opts_scatt
1433end if
1434
1435if (present(use_totalice)) then
1436 do_totalice = use_totalice
1437else
1438 do_totalice = .false.
1439end if
1440
1441! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1442! 2. Read coefficients
1443! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1444
1445if (debug) then
1446 write(string1,*)'The coefficient file is:',trim(sensor % coefficient_file)
1447 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1448end if
1449
1450call rttov_read_coefs(errorstatus, runtime % coefs, runtime % opts, instrument=instrument)
1451
1452if (errorstatus /= errorstatus_success) then
1453 write(string1,*)'Error reading coefs for platform/sat/sensor id combination:',&
1454 instrument
1455 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
1456endif
1457
1458if (present(opts_scatt)) then
1459 allocate(runtime % coefs_scatt)
1460 call rttov_read_scattcoeffs(errorstatus, runtime % opts_scatt, runtime % coefs, &
1461 runtime % coefs_scatt)
1462 if (errorstatus /= errorstatus_success) then
1463 write(string1,*) 'Error reading scatt coefs for platform/sat/sensor id combination:',&
1464 instrument
1465 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
1466 endif
1467end if
1468
1469if (size(sensor % channels) /= 0) then
1470 nchannels = size(sensor % channels)
1471else
1472 nchannels = runtime % coefs % coef % fmv_chn
1473end if
1474
1475! Ensure input number of channels is not higher than number stored in coefficient file
1476IF (nchannels > runtime % coefs % coef % fmv_chn) THEN
1477 write(string1,*) 'Number of requested channels too large: ',nchannels,&
1478 ' vs. ',runtime % coefs % coef % fmv_chn
1479 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1480endif
1481
1482! Ensure the options and coefficients are consistent
1483if (runtime % opts % config % do_checkinput) then
1484 if (debug) then
1485 write(string1,*) 'Now running rttov_user_options_checkinput'
1486 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1487 end if
1488
1489 call rttov_user_options_checkinput(errorstatus, runtime % opts, runtime % coefs)
1490
1491 if (errorstatus /= errorstatus_success) then
1492 write(string1,*) 'error in rttov_user_options_checkinput'
1493 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1494 end if
1495end if
1496
1497! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1498! 3. Allocate RTTOV input and output structures
1499! --------------------------------------------------------------------------
1500
1501! In DART RTTOV_Direct, we only simulate a single channel at a time for all ens members
1502allocate(runtime % profiles(ens_size))
1503
1504! Allocate structures for rttov_direct
1505CALL rttov_alloc_direct( &
1506 errorstatus, &
1507 1_jpim, & ! 1 => allocate
1508 ens_size, &
1509 ens_size, &
1510 nlevs, &
1511 runtime % chanprof, &
1512 runtime % opts, &
1513 runtime % profiles, &
1514 runtime % coefs, &
1515 runtime % transmission, &
1516 runtime % radiance, &
1517 calcemis =runtime % calcemis, &
1518 emissivity =runtime % emissivity, &
1519 calcrefl =runtime % calcrefl, &
1520 reflectance =runtime % reflectance, &
1521 init=.true._jplm)
1522
1523IF (errorstatus /= errorstatus_success) THEN
1524 write(string1,*) 'allocation error for rttov_direct structures'
1525 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1526endif
1527
1528if (debug) then
1529 write(string1,*) 'Successfully initialized rttov_direct platform/sat/sensor id combination:',&
1530 instrument
1531 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
1532end if
1533
1534if (present(opts_scatt)) then
1535 ! Allocate cld_profile for rttov_scatt
1536 allocate(runtime % cld_profiles(ens_size), stat=alloc_status)
1537 if (alloc_status /= 0) then
1538 write(string1,*) 'allocation error for cld_profiles array'
1539 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1540 end if
1541
1542 CALL rttov_alloc_scatt_prof( &
1543 err=errorstatus, &
1544 nprof=ens_size, &
1545 cld_profiles=runtime % cld_profiles, &
1546 nlev=nlevs, &
1547 use_totalice=do_totalice, &
1548 asw=1, & ! 1 = allocate
1549 init=.true._jplm, &
1550 mmr_snowrain=.true._jplm) ! true = kg/kg units for clouds
1551
1552 if (errorstatus /= errorstatus_success) then
1553 write(string1,*) 'allocation error for rttov_direct structures'
1554 call error_handler(e_err, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate)
1555 endif
1556
1557 allocate(use_chan(ens_size,runtime % coefs % coef % fmv_chn))
1558 allocate(runtime % frequencies(ens_size))
1559
1560 ! only the channels to simulate will be set
1561 allocate(runtime % frequencies_all(runtime % coefs % coef % fmv_chn))
1562
1563 if (size(sensor % channels) /= 0) then
1564 nch = size(sensor % channels)
1565 else
1566 nch = runtime % coefs % coef % fmv_chn
1567 end if
1568
1569 do i=1,ens_size
1570 runtime % chanprof(i) % prof = i
1571 end do
1572
1573 do i=1,nch
1574 use_chan(:,:) = .false._jplm
1575
1576 if (size(sensor % channels) /= 0) then
1577 ich = sensor % channels(i)
1578 else
1579 ich = i
1580 end if
1581
1582 ! Set use_chan to .TRUE. only for the ith required channel
1583 use_chan(:,ich) = .true._jplm
1584
1585 runtime % chanprof(:) % chan = ich
1586
1587 ! Populate chanprof and frequencies arrays for this one channel
1588 call rttov_scatt_setupindex ( &
1589 nprofiles=ens_size, &
1590 n_chan=runtime % coefs % coef % fmv_chn, &
1591 coef_rttov=runtime % coefs, &
1592 nchannels=ens_size, &
1593 chanprof=runtime % chanprof, &
1594 frequencies=runtime % frequencies, &
1595 lchannel_subset=use_chan )
1596
1597 runtime % frequencies_all(ich) = runtime % frequencies(1)
1598 end do
1599
1600 if (debug) then
1601 write(string1,*) 'Successfully initialized RTTOV-scatt cloud profiles for platform/sat/sensor id combination:',&
1602 instrument
1603 call error_handler(e_msg, routine, string1, source, revision, revdate, text2=string2)
1604 end if
1605end if
1606
1607end subroutine sensor_runtime_setup
1608
1609subroutine atmos_profile_setup(atmos, ens_size, numlevels, use_q2m, &
1610 use_uv10m, use_wfetch, use_water_type, use_salinity, &
1611 supply_foam_fraction, use_sfc_snow_frac)
1612
1613type(atmos_profile_type), intent(inout) :: atmos
1614integer, intent(in) :: ens_size
1615integer, intent(in) :: numlevels
1616logical, intent(in) :: use_q2m
1617logical, intent(in) :: use_uv10m
1618logical, intent(in) :: use_wfetch
1619logical, intent(in) :: use_water_type
1620logical, intent(in) :: use_salinity
1621logical, intent(in) :: supply_foam_fraction
1622logical, intent(in) :: use_sfc_snow_frac
1623
1624allocate(atmos%temperature(ens_size, numlevels), &
1625 atmos% moisture(ens_size, numlevels), &
1626 atmos% pressure(ens_size, numlevels), &
1627 atmos% sfc_p(ens_size), &
1628 atmos% s2m_t(ens_size), &
1629 atmos% skin_temp(ens_size), &
1630 atmos% sfc_elev(ens_size), &
1631 atmos% surftype(ens_size))
1632
1633! zero the arrays as well
1634atmos%temperature = 0.0_jprb
1635atmos% moisture = 0.0_jprb
1636atmos% pressure = 0.0_jprb
1637atmos% sfc_p = 0.0_jprb
1638atmos% s2m_t = 0.0_jprb
1639atmos% skin_temp = 0.0_jprb
1640atmos% sfc_elev = 0.0_jprb
1641atmos% surftype = 0.0_jprb
1642
1643if (use_q2m) then
1644 allocate(atmos%s2m_q(ens_size))
1645 atmos%s2m_q = 0.0_jprb
1646end if
1647
1648if (use_uv10m) then
1649 allocate(atmos%s10m_u(ens_size))
1650 allocate(atmos%s10m_v(ens_size))
1651
1652 atmos%s10m_u = 0.0_jprb
1653 atmos%s10m_v = 0.0_jprb
1654end if
1655
1656if (use_wfetch) then
1657 allocate(atmos%wfetch(ens_size))
1658
1659 atmos%wfetch = 0.0_jprb
1660end if
1661
1662if (use_water_type) then
1663 allocate(atmos%water_type(ens_size))
1664
1665 atmos%water_type = -1_jpim
1666end if
1667
1668if (use_salinity) then
1669 allocate(atmos%sfc_salinity(ens_size))
1670
1671 atmos%sfc_salinity = 0.0_jprb
1672end if
1673
1674if (supply_foam_fraction) then
1675 allocate(atmos%sfc_foam_frac(ens_size))
1676 atmos%sfc_foam_frac = 0.0_jprb
1677end if
1678
1679if (use_sfc_snow_frac) then
1680 allocate(atmos%sfc_snow_frac(ens_size))
1681 atmos%sfc_snow_frac = 0.0_jprb
1682end if
1683
1684end subroutine atmos_profile_setup
1685
